fields.description:
I have installed bamboo some week ago. It was working fine.  Today it has sucked and i have stopped it, and now I can not start it.
See attached log, message on web page:
Error 404 - Not Found.
No context on this server matched or handled this request.
Contexts known to this server are:

    * WebApplicationContext[/,Bamboo]

The links above may not work if a virtual host is configured
fields.summary: Can not start bamboo

fields.description: Freemarker will display all "Unknown" values and errors as dramatic yellow boxes. The most systems, the error is usually not critical and you just want the page to be displayed.
fields.summary: Bamboo should not die with freemarker error due to undefined values.
Implement build reasons on build status screens

fields.description:
Often Lucene lock errors go unnoticed as they don't get reported in the UI or in the build - current activity tab. For errors such as this -
{code}
2007-10-09 23:59:08,856 INFO [BAM:Main Queue:BuildExe] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording error: Could not save the build results : ProFinia - main
java.io.IOException: Lock obtain timed out: Lock@/tmp/lucene-0c47dc75d73a6919d2ee01255a1107a5-write.lock
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:58)
{code}
The user should be notified, so that the issue can be remedied immediately!

In cases such as [BSP-338|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-338], the error went unnoticed for days, resulting in unsaved builds.
fields.summary: Warn users if there are Lucene errors in the logs.

fields.description:
We are evalutation switching from CruiseControl to Bamboo but face same difficulties. 

We use a multiproject environment and since coming from cruisecontrol have some ant-scripts that check out for instance dependent projects.
For this to work we currently ignore the bamboo checkout and after our custom checkout get a folder structure like the following

xml-data
   build-dir
       PROJECT-PLAN1
           master-project       <- configured within bamboo
           checkout
                master-project   <- done by custom script
                dependent-project <- done by custom script
           reports
                junit    

This works (apart from some thing covered in other already tracked issues), if we use the follwing build configuration:

Working Sub Directory: ".."
Build File: "../../../build.xml"   (central buildfile handling checkouts and delegating to projects buildfiles)

We get into problems when using the options under "Where should Bamboo look for the test results file" (the same for clover files).
Bamboo always looks under 'xml-data/build-dir/PROJECT-PLAN1/master-project' .

Specifying "../reports/junit/*.xml" doesn't work :(

Apart from our maybe complicated looking situation I'd always prefer having build artifacts (like junit and coverage data) not in the directory where checkouts are performed. 
Then as well specifying a directory other than the checkout dir would be needed.
fields.summary: More flexibility in specifying Build-Root Dir

fields.description: We use the jira email extension, which assignes the issue to the CC recipient. Certain builds failures are high priority, and I would like Jira issues created for these.
fields.summary: It would be usefult to be able to 'CC' a user in a notification

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a view/screen to see when Polling the Repository for changes for each plan will be performed in time. 

This will make it easier to plan build plans to when to perform the "Polling the Repository for changes".
fields.summary: Build strategy and polling frequency overview

fields.description:
It doesn't make sense having RSS feeds orders from first to last, the project level feeds are ordered with the first build on top of the list.

This causes issues when embedding RSS feeds into confluence pages, to indicate the latest status of Bamboo builds, with the rss macro in confluence.

On a side note: The all plans feeds  are ordered with latest builds first on top of the feed list.

From BSP-335
{quote}
When using Confluence {rss:url=} tag.

I found that the 'all builds' RSS feed on Bamboo home page http://localhost/bamboo/start.action lists the feed in reverse order, which is good.

However, for individual build plan's 'all builds' RSS feed, it is NOT reverse order, but the 'failed builds' RSS feed is list in reverse order.
{quote}
fields.summary: The project level RSS feeds are ordered wrong.

fields.description:
The Bamboo Upgrade Guide says:

  "Back up the three directories you identified in Step 1 — your Bamboo Home, Build Data Path and Configuration Path"

however, the default "Build Working Directory" is located inside the "Bamboo Home".

Please clarify whether the "Build Working Directory" needs to be backed up, or if Bamboo will completely regenerate it from CVS/SVN/etc. if needed.
fields.summary: Clarify exactly what needs to be backed up when upgrading Bamboo

fields.description: I just discovered that bamboo wasn't building our plans for 4 days. The reason: there was an error during the svn update that was showing up in the bamboo error log, but was not causing the build to fail. So no messages were being emailed out and the dashboard still showed a happy green checkmark.  Could you improve the usability on this? Its pretty poor when there is an error that's broken the build and bamboo isn't notifying anyone.  Once I saw what the error was it was easy to fix.
fields.summary: SVN Update error doesn't trigger build error

fields.description:
The build expiry pages have changed
* You can now also specify labels that you DON'T want to be expired ar both plan and global level.
* There have also been some label/wording changes in the GUI

I have taken some basic screen shots and put them in my folder on dev files.

This will go in the next release (whether this is a point release or 2.0 I don't know)
fields.summary: Changes to build Expiry Configuration
When you disable the build expiry it doesn't actually disable

fields.description:
I've witnessed huge delays between hitting a "manual build" button and seeing the plan actually be listed in the build queue.  The time can range from nothing to hours, and it seems to primarily be caused by slow svn checkouts of large projects.  If a bunch of large projects are sitting in an svn queue (I'm assuming there is one), the manual build seems to effectively disappear until the large projects have been built.  In addition, there's no way to prioritize the manually built project in front of the large continuous integration projects - even if the CI projects are in a separate build queue, they're all waiting on SVN, so they're effectively in a single queue.

To reproduce this, create some build plans with large sets of source files (we have about 14k source files in our legacy projects), make them run in a continuous integration manner, then try to run some other projects using a manual build.  There's no feedback as to what is happening, and no way to get around it, which is frustrating our developers to no end.

I'd be happy with either of these fixes:
 1. Display projects that are scheduled for SVN polling in the build queue.  That way we'd know what's really waiting for an SVN checkout - but we'd also need projects in a separate build queue to not have wait for the SVN poll for a build in another queue to complete.
 2. Display a SVN queue, showing which projects are waiting for an update

Either way, manually built projects should jump to the front of the SVN queue.
fields.summary: subversion/source control queue
Un-stubify pipeline definition on remote agent.

fields.description: At the moment it's hardcoded in the Spring application context.  We should make it configurable.
fields.summary: Make JMS broker port number configurable
Need upgrade task for new Build field lastVcsRevisionKey

fields.description:
As per BAM-1225, Bamboo does't support CVS alias modules but there is a current workaroundd using CVS Ampersand modules

The only place we mentions this is in the [Bamboo 1.0.3 Release notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Bamboo+1.0.3+Release+Notes], 
- "In this release, the focus has been on improving SVN integration (detection of SVN Externals) and CVS integration (detection of ampersand modules)."

Should we split up http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/1.7+Specifying+a+Plan%27s+Source+Repository into three child-pages? One for perforce, CVS and Subversion?
fields.summary: Document the use of CVS alias and CVS Ampersand in Bamboo.

fields.description: As per [BSP-316|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-316], we should better document use of build variables in Bamboo.
fields.summary: Better documentaion for system variables,

fields.description:
The "expiry period" field in Bamboo - lets people choose - "how many days of Expire builds that completed before the above time period."

But in reality it looks at the last built date instead of current working date to figure out whether the build should be expired.
fields.summary: Build expiry is set to expire from last built date - as opposed to current working date.

fields.description:
The build expiry feature in Bamboo is very ambiguous - reading the documentation its still not clear what the difference between plan level and global build expiry preferences are! 

Also, Chai feels - the wording (on how to use the feature) on the global build definition page needs to be revisited.
fields.summary: Improve documentation for Build Expiry feature in Bamboo.

fields.description: If the build output is huge (~65000 lines, as in the case of BSP-318) Bamboo throws Outofmemory permgen space error as it tries to save the build result.
fields.summary: Bamboo runs out of Permgen space, when saving build result - due to massive build log output

fields.description:
If you access a user or author that doesn't exist via the url
eg.  http://localhost:8085/browse/user/john
        http://localhost:8085/browse/author/john

A lovely red and yellow screen shows with freemarker errors.

User Error:
{code}Error executing macro: getUserFullName
required parameter: user is not specified.
The problematic instruction:
----------
==> macro getUserFullName [on line 9, column 1 in lib/functions.ftl]
 in user-directive ui.header [on line 3, column 16 in admin/user/profile.ftl]
----------

Java backtrace for programmers:
----------
freemarker.template.TemplateException: Error executing macro: getUserFullName
required parameter: user is not specified.{code}

Author Error
{code}

The problematic instruction:
----------

 in user-directive ui.header [on line 7, column 5 in author/viewAuthor.ftl]
----------

----------

	at freemarker.core.TemplateObject.assertNonNull(TemplateObject.java:124)


{code}
fields.summary: Using a url to browse for a user or author that does not exist results in freemarker errors

fields.description: This is probably just a wording / placement problem.  The build expiry at the plan level is configured as a post build action therefore leading to the assumption that it will run post build, rather than some arbitrary time in the evening.
fields.summary: Bamboo gives the impression that Build Expiry will run at the end of the build

fields.description:
Bamboo will only complain about connection problems when you initially create the database.  
If bamboo can not connect to the database (eg it is not running) when it starts any other time it just hangs rather than erroring out with a message.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not log an error message if it cannot connect to PostGres dB on startup

fields.description:
As per [BSP-317|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-317] - see screenshots attached to this issue.

I was also able to replicate this locally - calling getLatestBuildResult returned
{code:xml}
<response>
      ......
     <buildTime>2007-10-04 15:50:39</buildTime>
</response>
{code}

Where as, Bamboo recorded it as "Build completed on Oct 4, 2007 3:52:11 PM - 22 hours ago".
fields.summary: The build time returned by getLatestBuildResult API call is wrong.

fields.description:
Hi,

I our setup we use multiple subversion repositories and our users have different logins for each of these repositories. As a Bamboo user currently only can specify one source repository alias we need to create multiple Bamboo users for each of our developers. It would be really nice to be able to attache multiple source repository aliases for a Bamboo user instead.

Cheers
/Claus
fields.summary: Multiple source reposistory aliases for a user

fields.description:
Currently, Bamboo uses CVS changelogs to determine build changes and syncs to changes to CVS

As per Bamboo should be able to sync and build to CVS labels. Instead of using CVS changelogs and building to each commit, Bamboo should sync/build only when new labels are created for the project.

Hypothetical use case;
   1. Bamboo is pointed to http://cvs.myrepo.com/ building application_module,
   2. There are 20 commits to fix a bug, Once the changes have been committed, The application is tagged as "fixed'Bug xxxx'
   3. Now that a new tag is created Bamboo should update and build to this tag.
fields.summary: Bamboo should checkout and sync to CVS labels.

fields.description:
Variables cannot be used when configuring artifacts in Bamboo. As per [BSP-314|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-314]

{quote}
I've added a build artifact, where the filename is based off of some bamboo variables, specifically bamboo.buildKey and bamboo.buildNumber.
If I specify the pattern as *.html, I end up with the build results from other builds, since they all end up in folder ./

I tried:

FortifySecurityScanHTML2 ./ ${buildKey}-${buildNumber}.html
FortifySecurityScanHTML2 ./ ${bamboo.buildKey}-${bamboo.buildNumber}.html

Neither of those work.
{quote}
fields.summary: Bamboo Variables should be available in the artifacts page.
Allow multiple auto-labelling rules per build plan
Serialize BuildContext Object

fields.description:
Hi all,

   the Firebird RDBMS Open Source project is using Jira for some time now ( > 1 Year ) and we are very happy with it and very greatfull. 

  We are thinking to use also Bamboo but the lack of Firebird DB support stopping us from doing so. 

  PLz, consider to add support for Firebird RDBMS also.

  regards,

  Dimitrios Chr. Ioannidis

fields.description:
BuildResults currently stores a lot of the outcome of the build in transient instance variables.

For the purposes of distributed builds, this state needs to be made Serializable.

fields.description:
When you change the build configuration (specifically source repository details) Bamboo will pick up the change and delete all the old source code so a clean check out can occur.  However, if the deletion fails it can cause some wierd behaviour (especially with perforce).

For an example of this behaviour see BSP-267.

We need to re-assess what should happen if this occurs.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not handle the failure to delete source code very well

fields.description:
Scenario; The plan PLAN_KEY creating artifact 'artifact1' and 'artifact2' as part of the build. 

Steps to replicate; Delete 'artifact1' from the build configuration page, kick off a new build.

Expected outcome; When viewing the http://BambooServer/download/PLAN_KEY/artifacts/latest page the deleted artifact 'artifact1' should not be listed.

Bug; The process of deleting artifact, does not inlcude updating the latest artifacts page, so in spite of the artifact being deleted, it gets listed in the /artifacts/latest page.
fields.summary: The link to latest artifact, on http://BambooServer/download/PLAN_KEY/artifacts/latest is not updated when a artifact is deleted.

fields.description: See screenshots
fields.summary: Freemarker error on BDAC

fields.description:
Scenario - Plan without anonymous user view rights.

Steps to replicate - hit the buld page for the plan such as, http://localhost:8085/browse/FD-DEF-3 and as expected the user is redirected to the login screen to enter his username and password. Enter the username and password.

Expected outcome - assuming the user has the correct permissions to view the page the buildresultsummary page for plan FD-DEF, build 3 is diplayed.

Bug - Instead of showing the build page, bamboo displays an error page with "Could not find the null'th build for build sf - Default" error message.

fields.description:
Hi,

I made two evaluation of Bamboo since July (unde Windows with HSL initialy).
And now, I am trying to perform the installation of Bamboo 1.2.3 on two differents environnement, but the both are gone to failure.

_*1st :*_
* IBM WebSphere Application Server - ND, 6.0.2.11 (cf110623.10) ... The JDK IBM 1.4
* Oracle Database 9i with Oracle Driver 10g

_*Applied Installation Procedure*_
* Datasource and JAAS account created and tested
* App Server and frontal IHS creation
* Aplpy Java Properties into AppServer Settings (bamboo.home, ...)
* Bamboo WAR installation
* Start of AppServer and WebApp
* No error in start : See !bamboo.was.log!

_*Failure :*_
* At 1s Access the following error is fired : {code}SRVE0232E: Internal Server Error.
Exception Message: [Filter [license]: filter is unavailable.]{code}
* See !bamboo.was.1st.access.log!

_*2nd Env. :*_
* Tomcat 5.5.12 with JDK Sun 1.5.0_12
 * Oracle Database 9i with Oracle Driver 10g

_*Applied Installation Procedure*_
* JDK and Tomcat with Manager Installation
* Oracle Driver ojdbc14-10.1.0.4.jar installed on *_TomcatDir_/common/lib*
* Bamboo Deployment through Tomcat Manager
* Stop WebApp (Started automatically by Manager during Deployment)
* Update *bamboo-init.properties* with a Bamboo reserved File System
* Restart of Bamboo WebApp
* Configuration stopped at Direct JDBC Configuration Connection step with Oracle with Failure Oracle 

_*Failure :*_
At *setup/setupStandardDatabase.action* step, the following warning is fired :
{color:red}Database configuration failed: Cannot initialize context because there is already a root application context present - check whether you have multiple ContextLoader* definitions in your web.xml!{color} 

It appears that these two failures have the same root cause, around  a Spring Context misconfigured !
I am not aware with Spring and do not have yet found a resolution among Internet searches.

Tks by advance.
V.
fields.summary: Spring Context error during installation

fields.description:
The Bamboo export/import process is highly inefficient 

The import process reads all XML files to memory and the SAX parser tries to parse the files off memory. For a (uncompressed) xml file size 1mb - Bamboo uses up about 7 mb of memory - this causes issues such as https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-285. Where the customers exported zip file is ~50mb, this translates into about 350-400mb of uncompressed XML files being parsed by Bamboo, which requires  upwards of ~3gb of heap space to be parsed successfully.

As Bamboo instances grow with time, we can expect the Bamboo-Home exports to be massive and this issue must be addressed A.S.A.P.
fields.summary: OutOfMemory error when exporting/importing large Bamboo instances

It would be helpful if Bamboo could log exceptions in a special file - other than atlassian-bamboo log file which may grow very big, if the customer is outputting huge amounts of build/test logs to atlassian-bamboo logs.

From, [BSP-293|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-293]

fields.description:
Freemarker exception on ViewBuildResultSummary due to failingSinceBuild=action.getFailingSinceForTest(buildResult, testResult). 

Post 1.2.1 build results are read off the index, this was done to increase performance.  If a user deletes one of the past builds, Bamboo will try to get the test details for the failing build.

This causes a freemarker exception as the failed build no longer exists!
fields.summary: Exception on ViewBuildResultSummary due to failingSinceBuild=action.getFailingSinceForTest(buildResult, testResult)

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo can associate one file type per artifact, users should be allowed to save multiple file types per artifact. 

Requested in [BSP-284|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-284]
{quote}
I want to save the test results (generated html) as artifact (in addition to the test results bamboo save for me; these are nice, but don't give the quick overview of all tests on one html page). This artifact contains of a bunch of html files and one stylesheet.
How do i specify this as Artifact Copy Pattern?
I tried

    * *.html *.css
    * [*.html, *.css] (entered as "*.html, *.css", bamboo adds the '[' brackets!)

Yeah, i could copy the whole dir, but it contains loads of test-output that i'd rather not file....
{quote}

h3. How it works in Bamboo
Bamboo uses single [Ant file copy pattern|https://ant.apache.org/manual/dirtasks.html] to specify copy pattern for artifact
fields.summary: Ability to copy multiple file types as one artifact

fields.description:
On some Bamboo instances, with LDAP integrated there may be excessive of 100+ groups depending on how the LDAP is configured.

In such a scenario, the user needs to look through all the available group list on the ViewGroups page - A better solution would be to let the user search for groups by name. This is very simliar to the search user functionality in the ViewUsers page.
fields.summary: Search available groups functionality - similar to search users.
The ViewGroups page does not list all available groups.

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability to see what builds a particular source file has been included in. So, given a source file name, I'd like to be able to list the builds for that file. This is the same concept as the Issue to build mapping that Bamboo currently supports except it is a source file to build mapping. 

This is useful when trying to diagnose build or test problems that relate to a known source file. If I know, for example, that foo.c introduced a bug, but I don't know where, I'd like to see all the builds where foo.c changed and look at the test results for those builds.
fields.summary: Lists builds by source file changes

fields.description:
It would be great to have similar functionality for Confluence as is currently available for JIRA, i.e. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Bamboo+Plugin

Please see suggestion from Bamboo forum:  http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=103&threadID=20140
fields.summary: create a Confluence Bamboo Plugin (similar to the JIRA Bamboo Plugin)

fields.description:
We have two build queues on bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com, one for stable builds and one for trunk builds. (Actually we have more, but two is enough to demonstrate the problem.)

Adding a new plan to either project doesn't automatically get it assigned to a build queue, so its initial build doesn't happen until I go in and add the new plan to a queue in Administration.

I can see a few possible solutions, in order of my preference:

1. Let me pick the build queue when I create the plan.

2. Allow projects to be assigned to queues, as well as plans. New plans in a project go to the queue for that project. (This would suit our stable/trunk breakdown.)

3. The administrator could designate one queue as the one to be used for new plans. Any newly created plan would be added here when created.

4. Bamboo could add new plans to the first build queue always. Not always what you'd want, but at least the plan would run and you could configure it later if it's the wrong one.
fields.summary: Creating a plan should add it to a queue configuration somehow

5. Clicked Save.
6. Back at the view profile page, my full name was blank and my email was blank. Same if I go back to edit profile.

Probably something to do with the Crowd integration.

fields.description:
In the Current Activity view users can see more in the error log than they should. All errors from all the plans are visible in this view.

Because we have different groups of users from different company's we don't want to let them see the other builds. This works great in bamboo, however this one view destroys the privacy of the projects. Error loggings name by detail the project which caused the error.

Please change this view, so that users can only see the error they should be allowed to see.
This issue is critical to us, because it prevents us from adapting bamboo for multiple projects
fields.summary: Bamboo Current Activity View's Error Log does not respect permission rights

fields.summary: FileNotFoundExecption when accessing 'Index Operations' screen in a new empty instance

fields.description: To avoid the possibility of data corruption, we should detect when Bamboo has been started with a database that has already been upgraded by a later version of Bamboo.
fields.summary: Prevent Bamboo from being run with a database that has been upgraded by a later version

fields.description:
It is possible to start multiple Bamboo processes running against the same Bamboo home.  This has been the underlying cause of a number of support issues.

We should prevent this by implementing a mechanism that prevents multiple instances of Bamboo being started against a single Bamboo home.  This mechanism would probably make use of some kind of lock file.
fields.summary: Prevent multiple instances of Bamboo from using the same database
Ability to specify SMTP port in order to connect to SMTP server.

fields.description:
We have been running Bamboo for a few months now, adding more and projects all the time. Among other build plans, each project has a full nighty build which is build at 04:00am. However we only want this plan to be triggered only when changes have been made to the repository. Currently there is no option to do this.

Note that polling the repository at 24h interval is not an option as this does not ensure the build is started at 04:00am or any other specific desired time of the day.
fields.summary: New Build Strategy: Polling the repository at a fixed time

fields.description: Is it possible to make bamboo to automaticly add a label/tag to a completed successful build into CVS and Subversion?
fields.summary: Set a label into CVS, Subversion etc

fields.description:

fields.description:
We are running unit tests which include some test cases with incomplete and skipped tests ... those are being marked incomplete or skipped.

Bamboo unfortunately marks such builds as failed!

The reason for marking a test incomplete or skipped is to tell we don't have a successful case, but it doesn't have any error.

We would need Bamboo to not behave like we would have a failing build.

Could you please support / implement the usage of incomplete / skipped tests? This feature is very urgent for our software development process.

Bet regards,
Max Horváth
fields.summary: Support for incomplete and skipped tests
Duplicated EhCache jar in Bamboo causes caching issue with Crowd

fields.description:
Seems the cache for the dashboard never updates the name of a plan when the plan name has changed.

To reproduce:
1. Create a build pan called "X"
2. Visit dashboard
3. Edit plan 'X" and change name to "Y"
4. Visit dashboard again - you should see that the name is still X
fields.summary: Bamboo dashboard never updates Plan name if it has been changed
Increase the VARCHAR(4000) in 'CUSTOM_INFO_DATA' column of 'BUILDRESULTSUMMARY_CUSTOMDATA' table from 4000
When editing notification rule, warning message about IM server missing appears even when one configured

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to get an aggregated feed of all builds within a project (all builds or failed builds). We have a lot of projects and each contains a lot of plans - subscribing to each plan is painful and the all plans feed is not specific enough.

A workaround is to have all plans in a project default labelled something, but you can't get only failed builds with a label.
fields.summary: RSS Feeds for all Plans in a Project

fields.description:
After update to Bamboo 1.2.3 generated build artifacts won't open directly in the firefox when mime type is hypertext or ascii text.
It does work in our safari browser as expected: the artifacts open inline in the browser.
Seems to be related to BAM-1646

I would suggest that this issue is not fixed for all browser types
fields.summary: Build artifacts wont open correctly in Firefox

fields.description:
It should be possible to automatically pause the build queues and trigger a script. This script/action should be triggered when no plan are building.
This could be handy if you wanted some periodic maintenance scripts to be run which may interfere with the build running on the server.  The automatic pause of all the build queues should be configurable (cron/ trigger). The queues should be resumed after all the triggers are executed.

Another quick solution would be to be able to configure the polling window for polling build.  And add launch a script with cron on the server outside the polling window. However you cannot be certain that all build queues will be empty. by the time you start the script.
fields.summary: Allow for build queues to be paused automatically

fields.description:
Raised due to BSP-250,

In some cases build logs contain sensitive data - such as system passwords and etc. A suitable solution would be to, restrict anonymous user's access to the logs.

For this we need more granular permissioning scheme in Bamboo.

Update:
Provide more granular permissions for Anonymous access.
- Ability to view logs
- Ability to download artifacts

One use case would be for projects whose clients need access to view the build flow and also download the artifacts without being able to run or change any plans. While creating individual user accounts for this would work as well it's less than ideal with a lot of clients needing accounts.
fields.summary: More granular permission scheme in Bamboo, ability to restrict access to logs

A user with all rights except admin rights cannot change the number of builds shown in the ViewbuildResults for a given plan.

See screenshots for further information
